description: Rubbish dumped on pavement: Lots of rubbish dumped all over pavement next to pedestrian crossing. This is happening here more and more since blue refuse bins have been taken away.
title: Rubbish dumped on pavement
detail: Lots of rubbish dumped all over pavement next to pedestrian crossing. This is happening here more and more since blue refuse bins have been taken away.

Why is it that some weeks the food waste is collected on Monday, but the garden waste is not collected until Tuesday? The same men who collect the garden waste come back the next day to empty the garden waste bins. Sometimes, including today, the food waste bins and the garden waste bins were all emptied into the same lorry. Are the foods waste bins and garden waste bins meant to be separated, or can they all go into the same collection?
title: Garden waste collection
description: Garden waste collection: Why is it that some weeks the food waste is collected on Monday, but the garden waste is not collected until Tuesday? The same men who collect the garden waste come back the next day to empty the garden waste bins. Sometimes, including today, the food waste bins and the garden waste bins were all emptied into the same lorry. Are the foods waste bins and garden waste bins meant to be separated, or can they all go into the same collection?

title: Dog mess
detail:
For some reason this stretch of street is being covered in horrible big lumps of dog mess at the moment. possibly some disgusting lazy pig has started walking their dog down this street. ? there are loads of young children living on the street and it is a real health hazard as the slobs let their dogs crap right in the middle of the footpath so children often trod in it.

Can the council dog mess team please do an urgent visit. thank you

Badly overgrown trees: All the trees in Aylward are badly overgrown from the base the the crown, they never used to be like this years ago, So i can only conclude that they are not being managed correctly, they need to be sorted out asap they are a big problem not only to the people who live in the road but also the people who are forced into the road because the trees are over grown all the way up the trunk from the ground to the crown, Also our road is being used as a rubbish tip because the trees conceal the rubbish being planted in them

Noisy metal cover
description: Noisy metal cover: The metals covers were installed a couple of years when they dug the road up to install electrical cables. They are located in the road near to the dropped kerb outside number 34 Senlac Road. The cover nearest to the centre of the road makes a noise when vehicles drive over it, this noise disturbs our sleep, we have tried to live with it but cannot no longer. Please get it fixed so we can get some sleep. Please do not mark this problem as fixed when nothing has been done about it.

Dangerous fence at Nesbit Close
description: Dangerous fence at Nesbit Close: There is a very dangerous wobbly fence on top of a large hill. The fence moves and is very close to homes below the hill. Non residents use the space in the fence as a short cut which damages the fence more making the gap bigger and wobbly. I originally reported this incident on 7th February 2022 to James however nothing has been done unfortunately and the fence continues to get weaker. The fence is now leaning back and is only a matter of time before it falls completely. Please can you advise. Many thanks

detail: The pavements and curbs along the length of Sprules Road (on both sides) have been covered in weeds for the last 18 months. In summer 2021 residents spent over 20 hours de-weeding large stretches of the road by hand, and we have just spent more than this again and barely made a dent on the Vesta Road and Drakefell Road ends. The weeds are a tripping hazard for people unsteady on their feet, but they are also unsightly and perhaps that untidiness, and apparent lack of care for our surroundings, contributes to passersby feeling they can litter and fly tip along the length of the road. Finally, soil seems to accumulate where the road surface meets the curbside, and that again provides much food for new crops of weeds to sprout. We could dearly benefit from the council both weeding the pavements and cleaning the road.

Eyesore untidy property
description: Eyesore untidy property: Hi there, apologies in advance if this type of report does not qualify for this channel. I'm not even sure if Lewisham deals with these types of issues (I've read that some councils do). Property 124, has a few untidy areas that need sorting. I've already reported fly-tipping at the front and here I'm reporting (1) an untidy terrace straight outside our bedroom window; and (2) an abandoned garden with blackberry aggressively spreading and overspilling into other properties/gardens. Again, apologies if this is not the right place to report such an issue. I do hope there's a chance that Lewisham council could encourage the owners to tidy up those areas. Thank you

description:
Graffiti: My recent report on graffiti on buildings and shutters was responded to by Lewisham Council in that if I notified them of a particular building they would try to include that in their programe for cleaning due to not enough funding or staff to take on any large scale cleaning to clear it. It surely needs someone from LBC to look at the state of the High Street and come up with something more positive to clear the problem.

What's happened to the CCTV cameras in the High Street. I'm sure the shop keepers can offer some help, it can't do their business much good trading in such a messy Street. The police must know the tags and the names/addresses of the people causing the damage Shops should not be allowed to sell spray paint or marker pens to under 21's.
title: Graffiti
detail:

title: Mess at Lewisham Homes property
description:
Mess at Lewisham Homes property: Hello, An unknown substance has been poured/spilled out of a window belonging to a Lewisham Homes property (flat 5 Stephens Court, 82 Endwell Road). This mess is now down the wall below and over the windows of the two flats below.

Lewisham Homes do not manage the whole of Stephens Court. However, they do rent flat 5 from the owner to provide social housing. Please can you check this as my other report was rejected.

Please can you arrange for someone from Lewisham Homes to attend and clean this up. Thank you.

Last year a brick pillar on the western corner of St Margaret's Square fell down - perhaps it was hit by a vehicle. Someone has moved it from the middle of the pavement and into the hedge, which is nice, but the smashed up brickwork remains on its side. It's unsightly and needs rebuilding in line with the rules for the conservation area.

description:
Bridge over the River Quaggy: The bridge over the River Quaggy is on the boundary of Bromley and Greenwich with Bromley being the highway authority for the bridge and to the east of the bridge. West of the bridge Lewisham is the highway authority, and north of the bridge Greenwich is the highway authority.

Shown in the picture is the shiny new 10T weight restriction sign installed at Bromley taxpayers' expense to the east of the bridge. There are no weight restriction signs to the north of the bridge (Greenwich) or to the west of the bridge (Lewisham).

Lewisham assert that the bridge now has a 40T weight limit (presumably believing it has been strengthened) and they gleaned this information from Bromley.

Either Bromley has squandered taxpayers' money on the new sign or Lewisham has made a mistake in removing the 10T limit signs.

To further confuse matters, there is a second bridge over the River Quaggy this time on Mottingham Lane, again on the boundary of Bromley and Greenwich, but with Greenwich the highway authority. Could it be that this bridge has the 10T limit.

Whatever the answer, this matter needs investigating as a matter of urgency, and the investigation should include liaising with Lewisham and Greenwich highway authorities to get to the bottom of this matter and ensuring that all three highway authorities display the correct signage for the bridge.
detail:

Lewisham assert that the bridge now has a 40T weight limit (presumably believing it has been strengthened) and they gleaned this information from Bromley.

Lewisham’s crews doing a sloppy job
detail: Lewisham’s crews ALWAYS leaving te bins all over the place when they come for collection, instead of putting them back in their dedicated storage. ALWAYS.
